originalText.text: Dr. Braverman is certainly not your average doctor. That said, his level of analysis is unparalleled and thorough. One of the things I search for in a doctor is a level of knowledge that inspires trust and confidence. While  one may occasionally encounter a brusque bedside manner, I believe his level of intellect makes up for, if not explains this. For many years I have seen doctors who told me things I already knew. Braverman on the other hand studies patients at multiple levels and does his best to educate them. This can sometimes feel like tough love, but he usually tells me the things I need to hear, not the things I want to hear.

originalText.text:
I first came to Dr Braverman thinking i was totally heathy, just a little overweight in May 2017. When I first met Dr Braverman, I was a little taken back by his "strong personality", but, I was able to see past that and I have to say that I feel that he is a brilliant man.
I am proud to say that I came to his office weighing 227 Lbs & now 1 1/2 years later I am maintaining my weight at 188 Lbs!  I am so impressed with him, I have trusted him with the healthcare of my wife, my father, my brother-in-law, my sister-in-law and my close friends.
I tell everyone that if you can look past his "strong personality" then you will really see how brilliant Dr Braverman is!

Pictures are April 2015 "before" and November 2017 / July 2018 "after"

I met him as a stranger & now I consider him to be a friend.

Thank you Dr Braverman!               -Nick DeBlasi Jr

originalText.text: In mid - November i was suffering from the onset of a gout attack in my right toe joint during work hours. I sent a text to Dr Braverman (yes, you can text him) Immediately, he returned the call , diagnosed and transferred me to one of his wonderful assistance at PATH Medical. Lisa proceeded to call my pharmacy with a script that was filled and waiting for me when I arrived. It has been over a month with no signs of relapse. Only one of the reason why I have already referred 3 friends to PATH

originalText.text:
I first became acquainted with PATH Medical via Dr. Braverman's Sunday evening radio broadcasts on WOR710AM sometime during the first months of 2004.  One particular broadcast remains vivid in my mind. Dr. Braverman's  keen grasp of the subject matter, the cadence in which he spoke, his compassion and understanding, were exemplary that evening. He was describing what it was like for a female to experience menopause. "It was as if she were standing in the middle of the ocean, and the waves were pounding her". Although his message was being conveyed on public airwaves, because I was experiencing those exact symptoms, it was as if he was speaking directly to me. I thought to myself, if a male physician could describe exactly how I felt, I had to go to his practice. My first appointment was in April 2004. I have been a patient ever since. Also, of special significance, is how Dr. Braverman incorporates his profound spiritual and religious beliefs as the foundation of his practice.
I invite readers of this review to make an appointment at PATH Medical.
I am confident that your medical questions will be responded to in a professional and caring atmosphere. Dr. Braverman practices an anti-aging model of healthcare. A proactive model of care, instead of a reactive one. Dr. Braverman can coordinate all the 10 doctors that we accumulate as we age. At PATH, the focus is on finding the potential medical issue before it becomes problematic. Please experience this wonderful and unique model of healthcare soon. Remember, "Nothing ventured, nothing gained".

originalText.text: I have been a patient of Dr. Braverman's for 15 years.  Blood tests every 3 months and bioidentical hormones.  I am 76 and look like I am 50, and blood tests show the body of a 40 year old.  I owe my fabulous life at this age to Dr. Braverman and his unique care.  I ball room dance 8 hours a week and do 2 hours with my personal trainer.  I love my active life, thanks to him...
